subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: I think that s a very sensible way to classify the characters. I ve put together a basic XML/XSLT page based on it that people can download/edit at
messageBody:
I think that's a very sensible way to classify the characters.

I've put together a basic XML/XSLT page based on it that people can
download/edit at http://uk.geocities.com/amd64_hacker/proposal/.
I've omitted sections A and F from the XSLT for the moment as they don't
have a direct impact on the proposal.
A lot of the data in the XML file isn't correct, a lot of characters in
section B should be elsewhere (section D mostly) and I'm sure there are
typos I haven't caught.

Anyway I hope is helpful for visualising the proposal.
And yes I do know I have no style and/or taste, I'm open to suggestions
for an alternate colour scheme. :)

John Cowan wrote:
>
> amd64_hacker scripsit:
>
> > My take on it is to only re-use Shavian characters where there would be
> > no confusion.
>
> I think all agree on this. We now need to reach detailed agreement
> on which Shavian characters can be reused and which cannot. I
> propose the following taxonomy:
>
> A. Some Shavian characters, like the r-colored vowels, have no
> Quickscript equivalents.
>
> B. Some Quickscript characters, like Loch and Llan, have no Shavian
> equivalents.
>
> C. Some Quickscript characters have exact Shavian equivalents,
> agreeing in both sound and shape.
>
> D. Some Quickscript characters have exact Shavian equivalents in
> sound, but are not like any Shavian character in shape.
>
> E. Some Quickscript characters have exact Shavian equivalents in
> shape, but are not like any Shavian character in sound.
>
> F. Some Quickscript characters have an exact Shavian equivalent in
> sound, and a different exact Shavian equivalent in shape.
>
> Now which are which?
>
> --
> You are a child of the universe no less John Cowan
> than the trees and all other acyclic http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
> <http://www.ccil.org/%7Ecowan>
> graphs; you have a right to be here. cowan@...
> <mailto:cowan%40ccil.org>
> --DeXiderata by Sean McGrath
>
>
